segment.source: Secure Boot isn't configured correctly: Determine if the PC is in a manufacturing mode (info for manufacturers)
segment.target: Secure Boot isn't configured correctly: Determine if the PC is in a manufacturing mode (info for manufacturers)

segment.source: While manufacturing PCs, if the "Secure Boot isn't configured correctly" watermark appears on the Windows desktop, you may need to determine whether Secure Boot is disabled or if the PC is in a manufacturing/debugging mode.
segment.target: While manufacturing PCs, if the "Secure Boot isn't configured correctly" watermark appears on the Windows desktop, you may need to determine whether Secure Boot is disabled or if the PC is in a manufacturing/debugging mode.

segment.source: The PC is in a manufacturing/debugging mode whenever a non-production policy is installed.
segment.target: The PC is in a manufacturing/debugging mode whenever a non-production policy is installed.

segment.source: For details, see the whitepaper: Windows 8.1 Secure Boot Key Creation and Management Guidance on the Microsoft Connect website, or contact your Microsoft account manager.
segment.target: For details, see the whitepaper: Windows 8.1 Secure Boot Key Creation and Management Guidance on the Microsoft Connect website, or contact your Microsoft account manager.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Did you see the "Secure Boot isn't configured correctly" watermark after upgrading to Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 R2, or Windows RT 8.1?
segment.target: Did you see the "Secure Boot isn't configured correctly" watermark after upgrading to Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2012 R2, or Windows RT 8.1?

segment.source: We'll be releasing a patch soon that gets rid of the watermark.
segment.target: We'll be releasing a patch soon that gets rid of the watermark.

segment.source: Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 users can install a patch to remove the watermark immediately: Microsoft Knowledge Base Article ID 2902864.
segment.target: Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 users can install a patch to remove the watermark immediately: Microsoft Knowledge Base Article ID 2902864.

segment.source: For more info, see Secure Boot isn't configured correctly: troubleshooting.
segment.target: For more info, see Secure Boot isn't configured correctly: troubleshooting.

segment.source: Determining if the PC is in a manufacturing mode
segment.target: Determining if the PC is in a manufacturing mode

segment.source: You can use any of the following methods to determine whether Secure Boot has been disabled or if the PC is in a manufacturing / debugging mode.
segment.target: You can use any of the following methods to determine whether Secure Boot has been disabled or if the PC is in a manufacturing / debugging mode.

segment.source: Use MSInfo32.
segment.target: Use MSInfo32.

segment.source: Click Start, type msinfo32.
segment.target: Click Start, type msinfo32.

segment.source: If BIOS mode: UEFI is UEFI and Secure Boot State is OFF, then Secure Boot is disabled.
segment.target: If BIOS mode: UEFI is UEFI and Secure Boot State is OFF, then Secure Boot is disabled.

segment.source: Check the event logs.
segment.target: Check the event logs.

segment.source: Go to Start View Event Logs Applications and Services Logs Microsoft Windows VerifyHardwareSecurity Admin, and look for either of these logged events:
segment.target: Go to Start View Event Logs Applications and Services Logs Microsoft Windows VerifyHardwareSecurity Admin, and look for either of these logged events:

segment.source: "Secure Boot is currently disabled.
segment.target: "Secure Boot is currently disabled.

segment.source: Please enable Secureboot through the system firmware."
segment.target: Please enable Secureboot through the system firmware."

segment.source: (The PC is in UEFI mode and Secure Boot is disabled.)
segment.target: (The PC is in UEFI mode and Secure Boot is disabled.)

segment.source: "A non-production Secure Boot Policy was detected.
segment.target: "A non-production Secure Boot Policy was detected.

segment.source: Remove Debug/PreRelease policy through the system firmware."
segment.target: Remove Debug/PreRelease policy through the system firmware."

segment.source: (The PC is in a manufacturing/debugging mode.)
segment.target: (The PC is in a manufacturing/debugging mode.)

segment.source: Use PowerShell commands.
segment.target: Use PowerShell commands.

segment.source: Open a PowerShell window as an administrator, and use following commands:
segment.target: Open a PowerShell window as an administrator, and use following commands:

segment.source: : checks to see if Secure Boot is disabled.
segment.target: : checks to see if Secure Boot is disabled.

segment.source: Responses:
segment.target: Responses:

segment.source: "True": Secure Boot is enabled, and the watermark won't appear.
segment.target: "True": Secure Boot is enabled, and the watermark won't appear.

segment.source: "False": Secure Boot is disabled and watermark will appear.
segment.target: "False": Secure Boot is disabled and watermark will appear.

segment.source: "Cmdlet not supported on this platform": The PC may not support Secure Boot, or the PC may be configured in legacy BIOS mode.
segment.target: "Cmdlet not supported on this platform": The PC may not support Secure Boot, or the PC may be configured in legacy BIOS mode.

segment.source: The watermark won’t appear.
segment.target: The watermark won’t appear.

segment.source: "Unable to set proper privileges.
segment.target: "Unable to set proper privileges.

segment.source: Access was denied.": Close PowerShell and reopen it as an Administrator.
segment.target: Access was denied.": Close PowerShell and reopen it as an Administrator.

segment.source: "Get-SecureBootPolicy": checks to see if you have a non-production policy installed.
segment.target: "Get-SecureBootPolicy": checks to see if you have a non-production policy installed.

segment.source: Responses:
segment.target: Responses:

segment.source: "{77FA9ABD-0359-4D32-BD60-28F4E78F784B}": The correct Secure Boot policy is in place.
segment.target: "{77FA9ABD-0359-4D32-BD60-28F4E78F784B}": The correct Secure Boot policy is in place.

segment.source: Anything other GUID: The PC is in a manufacturing/debugging mode, and the GUID for the non-production Secure Boot policy is shown.
segment.target: Anything other GUID: The PC is in a manufacturing/debugging mode, and the GUID for the non-production Secure Boot policy is shown.

segment.source: "Secure Boot policy is not enabled on this machine": Either Secure Boot is disabled, or the PC is configured to boot to legacy BIOS mode.
segment.target: "Secure Boot policy is not enabled on this machine": Either Secure Boot is disabled, or the PC is configured to boot to legacy BIOS mode.

segment.source: If the PC is in legacy BIOS mode, the watermark should not appear.
segment.target: If the PC is in legacy BIOS mode, the watermark should not appear.

segment.source: "Incorrect authentication data": Close PowerShell and reopen it as an Administrator.
segment.target: "Incorrect authentication data": Close PowerShell and reopen it as an Administrator.

segment.source: How do I fix it?
segment.target: How do I fix it?

segment.source: If Secure Boot is disabled, re-enable it.
segment.target: If Secure Boot is disabled, re-enable it.

segment.source: For more info, see Secure Boot isn't configured correctly: troubleshooting.
segment.target: For more info, see Secure Boot isn't configured correctly: troubleshooting.

segment.source: If Secure Boot is enabled but the PC is in a manufacturing/debug mode, you'll need to uninstall the non-production policy.
segment.target: If Secure Boot is enabled but the PC is in a manufacturing/debug mode, you'll need to uninstall the non-production policy.

segment.source: For details, see the whitepaper: Windows 8.1 Secure Boot Key Creation and Management Guidance on the Microsoft Connect website, or contact your Microsoft account manager.
segment.target: For details, see the whitepaper: Windows 8.1 Secure Boot Key Creation and Management Guidance on the Microsoft Connect website, or contact your Microsoft account manager.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Secure Boot isn't configured correctly: troubleshooting
segment.target: Secure Boot isn't configured correctly: troubleshooting
